  • Security patches or updates of the operating system,
  • Updates of the cryptography libraries,
  • Updates to mitigate known security risks in other used libraries, including open source libraries,
  • Security patches for any firmware,
  • Security patches for the software application itself.
Any mission that is intended to be operated more than 2 years security maintenance shall also be foreseen during operation phase.
Security patches shall be reviewed at least quarterly for implementation and patched as appropriate in agreement with the customer.
Code to be applied during security maintenance shall be tested and verified to the same level and with the same methods applied to the flight version.
For software in crypto-units or crypto-applications the requirements imposed by BSI and BW shall be applied in line to the approach of the original crypto-software development.

The follow requirements shall be applied to any new software development or developments of new Software modules for the Space Craft or already qualified ground segment. Unmodifies modules or software shall be kept unaffected by the development requirements and handled as re-use software.

chapters.name: QA Requirements for Ground Support Equipment (GSE)

requirements.text:
The supplier shall ensure that internal design and verification standards are used or developed corresponding with the techniques to be used and fitting with the level of complexity of the items to be developed.

The supplier shall ensure that development risks are identified and appropriate back-up solutions are identified.

The supplier shall ensure that the verification method and process are tailored to the:

  1. complexity of the item to be verified,
  2. criticality of the function to be implemented by the GSE item,
  3. inherent criticality of the item itself.
NOTE:
GSE is defined as:
optical, mechanical, fluid, electrical and SW support equipment or systems used for calibration, measurement, testing, simulation, stimulation, transportation, handling of space segment or space segment elements.
The supplier shall ensure that GSE is configuration controlled acc. with para. 2.2.7.

The supplier shall ensure that selected GSE suppliers have a demonstrated ability to conform to requirements, through:
  1. previous supply of items similar or more complex in the same field of techniques and technologies,
  2. certification covering similar design, development and production as applicable for similar items in conformance with 3.7.1.2 (Selection criteria), or
  3. evidence, documented by existing design, development, production and quality standards, of having similar experience associated with known success.

Procurement documents shall identify validation and receiving inspection requirements, and conform to the requirements in para. 3.7.2 (Procurement Documents).

The EIDP shall include:
  1. information regarding interfaces,
  2. deviations from contractual requirements,
  3. certification of conformance to an identified baseline,
  4. description of the functioning of the item, and instructions to operate and maintain it, and
  5. safety data or safety certification(s) conform to EC essential safety requirements of any applicable product safety regulation.
    NOTE:
    EC new approach directives shall be followed and CE marking shall be applied for GSE when applicable.

The supplier shall propose GSE elements for which acceptance is granted by a delivery board and agree these with his customer. The delivery board shall include QA representatives from the supplier and the customer.

The requirements of the following clauses shall be applied to the delivery of ground items and handling, storage, packing and shipping activities:
  1. preparation for delivery, in conformance with para. 3.10.4,
  2. delivery, in conformance with 3.10.5, and
  3. handling, storage and preservation, in conformance with para. 3.5.6.

Acceptance shall be achieved through a formal review process.
NOTE:
Review process is defined in ECSS-M-ST-10-01.

The acceptance process shall include:

  1. acceptance plan,
  2. inspection and test procedures, and
  3. inspection and test reports.

Acceptance may be achieved through a simple inspection process if agreed between customer and supplier.

PA activities shall be applied to the following subjects:
  1. safety provisions including assurance that the flight HW will not be exposed to potentially hazardous conditions during handling, connecting or testing,
  2. configuration control,
  3. NC control during verification-, qualification- and acceptance testing,
  4. verification control,
  5. handling and storage control,
  6. identification and labelling,
  7. packaging and transportation,
  8. materials and parts where contact is made to flight HW,
  9. witness of acceptance testing,
  10. SW, if deliverable item,
  11. conformance to national standards.

Parts, materials and components for GSE shall be consistent with safety requirements for this equipment and shall have practicable weight and be fully suitable for the intended use.
They shall not normally be identical to flight standard, and will be kept segregated from such flight items.

Where GSE interfaces with flight HW, such flight quality items or such items which will not degrade or contaminate (including out-gassing) the flight HW shall be used.

EEE components shall meet the requirements of para. 6.1.5.

The supplier shall ensure that maintenance activities are planned.

The supplier shall ensure that maintenance demonstration is performed in order to prove that maintainability requirements are satisfied in the real operational environment.

The manual shall provide all information, clear and complete instructions for installation, preparation, handling, connecting, operation, run-down and disconnecting of the GSE. It shall also include calibration and maintenance aspects.
Operations with risks for the flight HW and human-safety aspects shall be described in detail.

A dedicated OTS plan shall be established in conformance with the DRD-10.01.
NOTE:
The OTS plan describes the OTS equipment process selection, characterization and qualification activities in accordance with the contents of this ECSS Standard. The contents is specified in the annex DRD.

If as result of project investigation specified in 10.2.1.1, no space qualified products are found, and the intention to use OTS equipment is confirmed, the supplier shall extend the market survey to high quality and reliability products, to narrow down the selection of candidate OTS equipment to qualified manufactures and traceable production processes.
NOTE:
Examples of high quality and reliability products are, for instance, aeronautics, military, and nuclear.
The OTS equipment review selection process shall be synchronized with project review planning as per Figure 10-1.
The supplier shall generate and maintain an equipment specification with clear allocation of requirements for the OTS equipment and submit it for approval to the customer.
The supplier shall submit the preliminary equipment specification at the beginning of the OTS equipment identification phase and deliver it to the customer for review at system SRR.

drds.title: Equipment Specification
drds.deliveryDate: beginning of OTS equipment identification phase; SRR

requirements.text: The preliminary equipment specification shall be used as a technical reference for the market investigation and OTS equipment identification.
The equipment specification shall be formalized after SRR and shall be used during the OTS equipment characterization and selection.
The PDR issue of the equipment specification shall be used as an input to the final make-or-buy decision.
For each OTS equipment candidate, an OTS equipment evaluation dossier, in conformance with the DRD-10.02, shall be established during the market investigation and OTS equipment identification.
The OTS equipment evaluation dossiers shall be used to support the trade-off decision leading to the first preliminary make/buy decision point prior to SRR.
The OTS equipment evaluation dossiers of the remaining candidates shall be used to support the OTS equipment characterization and selection up to the final make/buy decision point at the system PDR.
After the buy decision has been taken, the evaluation dossier of the selected OTS equipment shall be maintained and updated to include all the results of the qualification phase.

chapters.name: Market Investigation and OTS Equipment identification

requirements.text: In order to evaluate the possible use of OTS equipment the supplier shall investigate the existence of products already successfully qualified in similar application.

If a result of project investigation specified as above, no space qualified products are found, and the intention to use OTS Items is confirmed, the supplier shall extend the market survey to high quality and reliability products, to narrow down the selection of candidate OTS equipment to qualified manufactures and traceable production processes.
NOTE:
Examples of high quality and reliability products are, for instance, aeronautics, military, and nuclear.
The supplier shall identify if the OTS equipment is proposed for use in a safety or mission critical function.
The supplier shall identify any potential criticality involved with the use of the OTS equipment.
The use of OTS equipment shall be avoided in safety-critical or reliability-critical functions, unless compliance with the full set of requirements applicable to the project can be demonstrated.
The use of OTS equipment is not allowed in reliability-critical functions.

The use of OTS equipment in a reliability critical function (see para. 4.8.2) is allowed under the condition that suitability for the specific usage in the space environment is fully demonstrated.
In general this requires a detailed assessment of the original design and sometimes modifications as well as additional tests. In general, equipment to be operated continuously or repeatedly are reliability critical if:
  1. Belonging to primary functions, such as power distribution / conditioning, communication / data management and cooling, or are
  2. equipment, whose failure would disable a safety device, propagate outside the payload, cause crew intervention (false alarm) or cause the initiation of saving procedure (e.g. failure of the fan supporting the smoke detector).

The supplier shall exclude a priori any OTS equipment whose performance has been previously reported as non-satisfactory.
NOTE:
When the OTS equipment is still affected by an active alert or equivalent industrial practices.
The supplier shall propose an OTS equipment which is designed for aerospace or military application in preference to an OTS equipment which is not.
The supplier shall identify any deviation of OTS equipment candidates from the equipment specification requirements.
The supplier shall identify all the OTS equipment functions which can lead to negative effects.
The supplier shall verify with the OTS equipment manufacturer the design margins, and prefer those determined by test.
The supplier shall gather all the available qualification data of the OTS equipment candidates.

The supplier shall collect all the available data relevant to the manufacturer in order to evaluate its experience, position and stability in the business, and OTS equipment commercial business practices, strategies in development, maintenance, distribution of updates, availability of spares, willingness to co-operate with the supplier.
The supplier shall collect all the information to allow the rough estimation of the OTS equipment cost, taking into account all aspects.

Based on the data collected during the market investigation the supplier shall decide, prior to the system SRR, if to propose a "buy" approach on the basis of the existence of viable OTS equipment in a minimum number of two.
When several viable OTS equipment candidates exist, the supplier shall perform a trade-off activity to reduce their number to a maximum of three.

The trade-off activities shall be based as a minimum on the following criteria:
  1. OTS equipment ability to provide the required capabilities and performances and to cope with the system design constraints,
  2. OTS equipment compliance with the PA and safety applicable project requirements,
  3. OTS equipment compliance versus the function criticality at system level,
  4. OTS equipment testability,
  5. OTS equipment compliance with the interface requirements,
  6. OTS equipment ability to be procured and used without special restrictions,
  7. ITAR, exportability, and copyright,
  8. short and long term cost impacts of using the OTS equipment,
  9. technical, cost and schedule risks in using the OTS equipment,
  10. availability of OTS equipment certification documentation,
  11. proper tracking of configuration changes,
  12. manufacturer experience, position and stability in the business, willingness to cooperate, possibility to place contractual arrangement for supporting the system development and maintenance phase,
  13. manufacturer quality system,
    NOTE:
    For example: The OTS equipment manufacturer can demonstrate a track record for production, quality control procedures are established.
  14. obsolescence possibilities and back-up solutions,
  15. OTS equipment life cycle support.
    NOTE:
    For example: Availability of spares, refurbishment possibilities, service experience supporting the successful operation of the OTS equipment, repair capability.
The supplier shall perform the OTS equipment characterization activity with respect to the equipment specification ensuring that all the requirements are met.

In the frame of the OTS equipment characterization of requirement 10.3.1, the supplier shall collect in the evaluation dossier the following:
  1. available users documentation,
  2. manufacturer data sheet derived requirements and their validation and verification,
  3. available qualification status versus preliminary equipment specification,
  4. available test data,
  5. existing anomalies, NC reports and problem reports,
  6. potential evolutions,
    NOTE:
    For example: Future manufacturer modifications.
  7. results of the PA activities evaluation as per clause 10.3.2.
The supplier shall evaluate and agree the system architecture modifications that allow the usage of the OTS equipment minimizing the need of OTS item modification.
The output of the OTS equipment characterization phase shall be the make-or-buy decision.

chapters.name: Product Assurance Evaluation for OTS Equipment Characterization

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify the system level RAM analyses to identify if the OTS equipment is used in critical functions and request customer approval for its application.

The supplier shall assess the dependability criticality of the OTS equipment on the basis of the specific application.
NOTE:
For example (in order of increasing criticality): Experiments or payload; satellites; manned modules; launchers; re-entry vehicles.
The supplier shall identify the dependability technical risks in satisfying dependability requirements.

The supplier shall analyse the OTS equipment in the FMECA as a black box.
NOTE:
This in order to assess functions and interfaces criticalities versus the system requirements.
The supplier shall get the analysis from the manufacturer when available or consult the available analysis or design files at manufacturer site.
The supplier shall collect the information from manufacturer on the OTS equipment monitoring status.
The supplier shall provide dedicated interfaces towards the OTS equipment via ad-hoc data interface unit.
The supplier shall co-ordinate with the first level supplier the compensations for the missing monitoring.
The supplier shall verify capability to control the equipment in all operational conditions to prevent failures and hazards.
The supplier shall verify the capability to switch-off the equipment in all conditions, considering also the case of internal equipment battery provision.
The supplier shall verify compatibility of OTS equipment warm-up time with respect to system performances.
The supplier shall identify OTS equipment maintenance requirements.
The supplier shall identify provision of installation and maintenance features to prevent failure.
The supplier shall verify the possibility that the manufacturer can provide spares throughout the project duration.

chapters.name: Internal Redundancy / Design for Minimum Risk

requirements.text: When evaluating the OTS equipment internal redundancy, the supplier shall ensure that the project failure tolerance requirements are complied with.

The supplier shall not use internally redundant OTS equipment without the availability of the following information:
  1. the reliability history,
  2. OTS equipment internal redundancy management and architecture.

The supplier shall provide all the missing information on the internal redundancy and design to minimum risk on the OTS equipment.
NOTE:
For example: X-ray, NDI inspections, proof test, and functional test.

The supplier shall provide an OTS equipment reliability figure to support system-level reliability assessments or engineering trade-offs.
NOTE:
If the reliability figure is not provided by the manufacturer, it can be obtained e.g. by the following means:
  • search for data from experience from previous use,
  • assess data credibility via manufacturer interview and OTS equipment evaluation,
  • independent expert judgement,
  • assess OTS equipment reliability via prediction,
  • assess OTS equipment reliability via similarity,
  • perform prediction (part count) when equipment EEE part list is available.

The supplier shall ask the existing field data that justify the operational life claimed by the manufacturer.
NOTE:
For example: Market feedback for the products, WCA, possibility to get the internal parts activation energy characteristics and operating temperature.
The supplier shall assess life data credibility via manufacturer interview and equipment evaluation.
The supplier shall assess the need for performing a life test at equipment level.
The customer acceptance is required for requirements above.
The supplier shall get data on the actual OTS equipment derating factors and on its proven heritage, and assess if OTS equipment derating is critical with respect to the mission requirements.

In case the requirement above cannot be met, the supplier shall perform analysis and test on the equipment.
NOTE:
The use of board thermography is to get a rough estimation of thermal margin on the most critical components also via identification of temperature hot spots, generate thermal model of PCB and provide simulations.
The OTS equipment shall conform to the safety requirements of the function in which it is used.
For safety critical applications any OTS internal redundancy shall not be considered.

Approval of the critical OTS equipment materials is requested by means of MUA at OTS equipment level (for MUA see para. 7.5.5).

All the materials related technical information shall be attached to the MUA. If the available materials information is not suitable to support the MUA acceptance, then proper recovery action should be taken and reference made in the MUA.
For the MUA the DRD-7.04 shall be used.

The supplier shall provide safety data containing information on used materials, mechanical parts, electrical components, and in general all the information necessary to perform the safety analysis.
NOTE:
Electrical components include internal energy sources like batteries, shatterable materials.
The supplier shall, for manned modules, ensure compatibility between pressure differential and fire control requirements for all those cases where depressurization is a fire control method.

The supplier shall, in case information cannot be obtained from the manufacturer, perform the necessary verification activities.
NOTE:
For example: X-Ray, NDI inspections, and proof test.
All safety requirements of section 5 shall be fully applicable to the OTS equipment.
The project safety reviews shall also include the safety related work for the OTS equipment.
The project safety documentation shall include the safety related documentation for the OTS equipment.
For the verification of safety and vehicle interface requirements, the requirements of chapter 5 of this document shall be considered.

applicableDocuments.title: ESA-HRE-IPL-RQ-0002
applicableDocuments.description: Product Assurance and Safety Requirements for ISS Pressurized Payloads

requirements.text: Preference shall be given to OTS equipment candidates for which the employed EEE parts are known.
The supplier shall, in case of part list provision, assess the information provided for each EEE part.
The supplier shall perform inspection on OTS equipment to evaluate confidence on provided part list or, if no list is provided, identify constituent EEE parts.

The supplier shall perform analysis or a test campaign to assess the compliance of the whole OTS equipment with project requirements.
NOTE:
For example: Total dose radiation test.
Evaluate the EEE parts with regards to the environmental conditions like temperature, radiation and vacuum.
The supplier shall perform PCB inspection to identify used parts.
The supplier shall perform in-depth inspection to acquire the information necessary to complete the OTS equipment dossier.

The supplier shall decide on risk reduction measures in order to solve the EEE parts potential issues.
NOTE:
For example: PCB coating, equipment segregation, exchange of parts, exchange of connectors and harness, introduction of epoxy adhesive for massive components of the PCB to allow the equipment surviving the acceleration and vibration test conditions.

The OTS equipment shall be inspected for EEE components with known mechanical or electrical instability (see para. 6.2.2.2). These components shall be replaced as far as possible.

Otherwise measures shall be taken to increase their stability.
Requirements according para. 6.2.2.2 (parts and material restriction) apply also for OTS equipment.

The OTS equipment shall be reviewed for radiation sensitive components which are not compliant to the project needs.

These components shall be replaced as far as possible.

Otherwise measures shall be taken to protect these components from radiation.

For Interface applications, the OTS equipment shall be reviewed for radiation sensitive components which are not compliant to the project needs.

These components shall be replaced as far as possible.

Otherwise measures shall be taken to protect these components from radiation or to prevent failure propagation by implementation of EDAC methods (EDAC, Error Detection and Correction).

PCBs, terminal boards, switches, relays and similar components should be potted, sealed, or similarly protected with an approved non-flammable compound against the effects of liquid leakage or condensation and against shorting by materials floating in zero gravity environment. This will also help to justify the item with respect to flammability and offgassing.

Concerning interfaces, PCBs, terminal boards, switches, relays and similar components should be potted, sealed, or similarly protected with an approved non-flammable compound against the effects of liquid leakage or condensation and against shorting by materials floating in zero gravity environment. This will also help to justify the item with respect to flammability and offgassing.

The supplier shall assess part purchase policy applied by the OTS equipment manufacturer.
NOTE:
Part quality level, multiple suppliers for each part type, part incoming inspection, burn in data, and mechanical tests.

The supplier shall assess manufacturer part handling approach.
NOTE:
Storage and transport control, control of assembly process versus standard as function of part type characteristics, e.g. plastic parts).
The supplier shall procure OTS equipment from a recognized source, either directly from the manufacturer of the equipment or from an authorized procurer of the manufacturer of the equipment.
The supplier shall be able to track the supply chain back to the manufacturer of the OTS equipment.

The supplier shall perform inspection on OTS equipment.
NOTE:
This inspection aims at improving confidence on provided part list and when no list is provided to identify constituent materials and mechanical parts.

The supplier shall perform an analytical assessment or a test campaign to assess the whole equipment compliance with project requirements.
NOTE:
For example: Toxicity, flammability and out-gassing tests.

The supplier shall decide on risk reduction measures.
NOTE:
For example: Equipment segregation, exchange of parts if materials are non-compliant, conformal coating or potting of the PCBs with non-flammable compound, exchange of housing, exchange of specific flammable parts.
Requirements acc. para. 7.5.3.1 (constraints) apply also for OTS equipment.
The supplier shall perform OTS equipment inspection to identify the presence of any prohibited materials.

The supplier shall perform lab inspection.
NOTE:
For example: Chemical, offgassing, out-gassing, flammability.
The supplier shall decide on risk reduction measures in order to solve the prohibited material issue and request customer approval.

Inspection of PCBs, if possible shall be performed using:
  • ECSS-Q-ST-70-08,
  • ECSS-Q-ST-70-38 (High-reliability soldering for surface-mount and mixed technology),
  • ANSI/IPC-A-610 Class 3, Acceptability of Electronic Assemblies

as guidelines.
Inspection of OTS equipment shall be performed to prove that the agreed modifications, changes and/or replacements are implemented.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-Q-ST-70-08
applicableDocuments.description: Manual soldering of high- reliability electrical connections (6 March 2009)

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-Q-ST-70-38
applicableDocuments.description: High-reliability soldering for surface-mount and mixed technology (15 September 2017)

applicableDocuments.title: ANSI / IPC-A-610
applicableDocuments.description: Acceptability of Electronic Assemblies

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify that the OTS equipment is able to operate in the mechanical environment of the specific application.
The supplier shall verify that the OTS equipment does not generate any detrimental mechanical effect within the operational environment.

The supplier shall identify that the modifications to be performed on the OTS equipment, in order to cope with the anticipated mechanical environment, are justified and their adequacy is demonstrated.
The supplier shall perform verification of the structural characteristics of the OTS equipment in accordance with the requirements of ECSS-E-ST-32.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-32
applicableDocuments.description: Structural general requirements (15 November 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify that OTS equipment is able to operate in the thermal environment of the specific application.

The supplier shall verify that the OTS equipment thermal design is able to withstand those environmental factors encountered during all mission phases and take due account of any possible degradations.
NOTE:
Causes for degradation can be e.g. wear, non-condensable gas build-up, mechanical loads, and test environment.
The supplier shall ensure that any OTS equipment cooled by natural convection system is modified to a suitable alternative cooling method.
The supplier shall analyse and identify any modification to be performed on the OTS equipment in order to cope with the foreseen thermal environment.

The supplier shall consider the safety related requirements, like touch temperature, flammability problems and ignition hazards, as driving criteria for the OTS equipment acceptance or exclusion from the early phases of the evaluation process.
The supplier shall verify the OTS equipment thermal requirements in accordance with ECSS-E-ST-31.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-31
applicableDocuments.description: Thermal control general requirements (15 November 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify that the OTS equipment electrical design is able to operate in accordance with the intended application.
The supplier shall identify through analysis all the modifications to be performed on the OTS equipment in order to cope with the required electrical performances.

All safety issues shall be considered as driving criteria for the OTS equipment acceptance or exclusion from the early phases of the evaluation process.
NOTE:
Safety issues can be high voltages or high electrical powers, EMC/EMI, grounding, and radiation.
Warm-up time of the OTS equipment shall be verified to ensure compatibility of the equipment with the system needs.
The supplier shall verify the OTS equipment electrical requirements in accordance with ECSS-E-ST-20.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text:
AC/DC shall not be used in space applications.
NOTE:
This constraint forces to remove or to exclude the unit power supply and redesign it.
The OTS equipment new power supply shall be designed and manufactured by the supplier according to the space environment and constraints in accordance with ECSS-E-ST-20.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: The OTS equipment, where the already available DC/DC converter input power lines are compatible to spacecraft power bus, shall be verified or modified by the supplier according to the space environment and constraints as per ECSS-E-ST-20.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: Fuses whose performances are not in accordance with the ECSS-E-ST-20 shall be removed and replaced by the supplier with other fuses or other appropriate devices.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: For OTS equipment where the only power source is a rechargeable or non-rechargeable battery, the supplier shall investigate the possibility to substitute this power source by a space qualified one.
In case a substitution of such power source is not possible, a DC/DC converter shall be designed by the supplier according to the space environment and constraints of ECSS-E-ST-20.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier proposing the use of an OTS equipment data handling system or of an OTS equipment as a part of a data handling system shall verify its design requirements according to ECSS-E-ST-50-14.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-50-14
applicableDocuments.description: Spacecraft discrete interfaces (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier proposing an OTS equipment interfacing with a data handling system shall verify its interfaces performances according to ECSS-E-ST-50-14.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-50-14
applicableDocuments.description: Spacecraft discrete interfaces (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: For OTS equipment with non-compatible data interfaces, a dedicated interface adapter shall be developed by the supplier, in order to ensure the compatibility, according to ECSS-E-ST-50-14.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-50-14
applicableDocuments.description: Spacecraft discrete interfaces (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify the OTS equipment RF compatibility according to ECSS-E-ST-50-02.
The supplier shall implement the modifications on the OTS equipment to comply with the RF requirements of ECSS-E-ST-50-05.

requirements.text: The supplier shall verify OTS equipment conformance to EMC requirements according to ECSS-E-ST-20.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-20
applicableDocuments.description: Electrical and electronic (31 July 2008)

requirements.text: For OTS equipment that exists in plastic cases only, the viability of upgrading their housing to a metallic one shall be investigated and implemented by the supplier, where feasible.
The supplier shall verify OTS equipment conformance to project applicable radiation environment.

The analysis of OTS equipment EEE internal parts for the TID, Non-Ionising Energy Loss Fluence (NIEL) and the SEE due to the heavy ions and high energy protons shall be performed by the supplier in accordance with ECSS-E-ST-10-12.

applicableDocuments.title: ECSS-E-ST-10-12
applicableDocuments.description: Methods for the calculation of radiation received and its effects, and a policy for design margins (15 November 2008)

requirements.text: The supplier shall perform a dedicated analysis to evaluate the criticalities from SEU and Latch Up (LU) and provide adequate preventive or corrective actions.

For OTS equipment not specifically characterized for space applications in terms of radiation behaviour, a dedicated test campaign shall be conducted by the supplier to measure the sensitivity of this equipment in terms of at least TID with Gamma rays, SEEs with protons beams.

For OTS components a radiation assessment is required. In order to make a proper assessment it is important to keep control over the as built electronic configuration, i.e. identification of part types and manufacturers for EEE parts.
NOTE:
The ISS document SSP 30512 provides criteria and data to identify the applicable ionizing radiation environment requirements.
The supplier shall identify any prohibited parts according to project requirements and take corrective actions in accordance with para. 6.
Supplier shall ensure that assembled PCBs are repaired or modified according with para. 7.7.6.4.
The supplier shall identify any materials, mechanical parts and processes prohibited by project requirements and take corrective actions in accordance with para. 7.
The supplier shall identify any maintenance activity specific for the OTS equipment.
The supplier quality responsible shall ensure that the following evaluation activities are correctly implemented.
Based on the data collected and on the results achieved during the characterization phase, the supplier shall decide if to propose the final buy approach, not later than the system PDR.
The OTS equipment qualification capability shall be demonstrated by the supplier together with conformance with the EQSR approach.
At the system PDR, the supplier shall submit to the customer for concurrence, the final OTS equipment make-or-buy decision.

The supplier shall identify the procurement document and freeze it in the OTS equipment evaluation dossier.
NOTE:
A procurement document can be an OTS equipment dedicated specification or the manufacturer bulletin.
From the data of the OTS equipment evaluation dossier a final OTS equipment report shall be issued by the OTS item supplier and approved by the first level supplier.

The supplier shall purchase all OTS equipment from a single lot.
NOTE:
Single lot purchase is done to minimize the risks deriving from OTS equipment developed at different times and with differences in terms of materials, internal parts (including EEE parts) and with differences in the development process.
The supplier shall verify that lot variances do not impact the data contained in the OTS equipment evaluation dossier.
The supplier shall check that the number of OTS equipment purchased in the same lot conform to the project needs and with the obsolescence strategy of the manufacturer.
The supplier shall make sure that the number of the OTS equipment purchased include spare parts and maintenance needs.

chapters.name: Configuration Control of Modified OTS Equipment

requirements.text:
In order not to lose the cost and schedule advantage of OTS equipment, the modifications should be kept to a minimum.

Care shall be taken that no new failure mechanisms are introduced by the modifications into the well-proven equipment.

The OTS equipment user shall also investigate the feasibility and the cost/schedule effectiveness of additional modifications to increase the quality and reliability of OTS equipment, including:

  1. protection against failure effects on other equipment,
  2. meeting the flammability, offgassing, and safety requirements,
  3. design change in case of non-compliance to quality level EEE components performance requirements,
  4. introduction of higher reliability/quality level EEE components.

The supplier shall ensure that, in case the final OTS equipment candidate needs modifications to meet the project requirements, these modifications are kept under configuration control by the configuration control methods applicable to the project.
The supplier shall verify that the procurement documentation of the OTS equipment is in accordance with chapter 3.

chapters.name: Failure Reporting, Nonconformance Control and Corrective Actions

requirements.text:
The requirements of para. 3.5.1 (NC Control System) are fully applicable for OTS equipment.
NOTE:
Only after delivery.
The principles, approach, methodology, implementation and documentation requirements of ECSS-E-ST-10 shall apply.

requirements.text: The fundamental concepts of the verification process, the criteria for defining the verification strategy and the rules for the implementation of the verification program, established within ECSS-E-ST-10-02 shall be followed.

requirements.text: The supplier shall derive the OTS equipment qualification program from the equipment specification.
The supplier shall use the accepted OTS equipment evaluation dossier and the relevant OTS equipment reports as an input to the qualification program.

For ISS internal payloads, in addition to the functional and environmental tests performed at payload level, all OTS components shall be subjected to a burn-in test (168 hours at the maximum temperatures specified for the operating mode within the payload). This test can be performed at payload level.

requirements.text: OTS equipment is those that, even if not necessarily developed for space applications, can be procured from the market and utilized in a space system.
OTS equipment shall be approved by the DLR according to the RFA procedure (see para. 3.5.8.3).

This document contains the Space Debris Mitigation requirements of the Product-Assurance and Safety-Requirements for DLR-Space Projects (DLR-RF-PS-001) chapter 11.
For any NC with a requirement of this chapter, a RFD shall be requested containing the appropriate rationale and justification and requires formal acceptance by DLR.
